conclusion: Loading and unloading are essential components of the logistics process. The speed of the conveyor is adjustable, allowing different speeds to be set for different types of goods. The length of the conveyor is also adjustable, enabling it to extend directly into trailers for operation. Additionally, the height of the conveyor can be adjusted, making it convenient for workers to directly handle goods located at higher positions in the cargo compartment.

If cargo (which can be considered as a particle) is at the same height as the conveyor, the schematic diagram of the conveying process is shown in Figure C. It is known that the length of the conveyor is L1=6m, and the conveyor moves clockwise at a speed of v0=2m/s. The kinetic friction coefficient between cargo A and the conveyor is μ1=0.2. Cargo is released from rest at the left end of the conveyor.
Find the acceleration of cargo A when it is just placed on the conveyor and the time it takes to travel from the left end to the right end. (Take g=10m/s².)

premise: The cargo is initially at rest and is placed on the conveyor which is moving at a speed v0 = 2 m/s. The kinetic friction coefficient between the cargo and the conveyor is μ1 = 0.2.
conclusion: The force of kinetic friction acting on the cargo is given by F_friction = μ1 m g.

premise: The force of kinetic friction acting on the cargo is F_friction = μ1 m g.
conclusion: The acceleration of the cargo due to the frictional force is a1 = μ1 g = 0.2 × 10 = 2 m/s².

premise: The cargo will continue to accelerate until its speed equals the speed of the conveyor. We use the equation of motion v = u + a t where u = 0 and v = v0 = 2 m/s.
conclusion: t = v0 / a1 = 2 m/s / 2 m/s² = 1 s.

premise: The time taken to reach the speed of the conveyor is t = 1 s.
conclusion: The distance traveled by the cargo in this time is s1 = 1/2 a1 t² = 1/2 × 2 m/s² × (1 s)² = 1 m.

premise: After the cargo reaches the speed of the conveyor, it will move with the same speed as the conveyor. The remaining distance to be traveled is L1 - s1 = 6 m - 1 m = 5 m.
conclusion: The time taken to travel the remaining distance is t2 = 5 m / 2 m/s = 2.5 s.

premise: The total time is the sum of the time to accelerate and the time to travel the remaining distance: t_total = t + t2 = 1 s + 2.5 s.
